cwe_description: The product reads data past the end of, or before the beginning of, an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or execution of arbitrary code.
explanation: The code reads `attr->info.rtvp_annotations_attr.num_parameters` from `buffer[offset]` after `offset` has been advanced by 6. If the provided buffer size `sz` is less than or equal to 6, accessing `buffer[offset]` (which would be `buffer[6]`) will result in an out-of-bounds read, potentially leading to a crash or information disclosure.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The code reads buffer[offset] to determine num_parameters after offset has been incremented to 6. If the provided buffer size (sz) is less than or equal to 6, this access will result in an out-of-bounds read. Furthermore, inside the loop, the condition if (offset > sz) should be if (offset >= sz). If offset equals sz, r_bin_java_annotation_array_new is called with buffer + sz and a size of 0. If this function attempts to read any data, it will cause an out-of-bounds read.
